info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 01 at 5:40PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Slow moving band of snow over much of Central and Southwest Montana... At 530 pm...A band of moderate to heavy snow extended from Northwest Beaverhead County through Central Montana into the Bears Paw Mountains. This area of snow will continue to move slowly southeast through around 730 pm into the Dillon, Bozeman, and Lewistown areas. Most areas will receive an additional inch or so of snow, while the mountains will receive another 1 to 3 inches. Lighter snow to the northwest of this band will continue to decrease, with less than one half inch of additional accumulation. The snow will likely reduce visibility to less than one mile at times. One thing to note is that the valleys ahead of this band, including the Dillon, Bozeman, and White Sulphur Springs areas, are still above freezing as of 530 pm. This will likely cause a brief period of rain that will quickly change over to snow. This will cause wet roadways to become icy as temperatures fall below freezing before the snow starts to accumulate. Be careful if driving through these areas, and be ready for rapidly changing road conditions and visibilities.
